The ocean is one of Earth’s largest ecosystems and helps moderate our climate. NASA has an array of missions dedicated to studying this precious part of the planet, with more to come. 

Dive in: http://go.nasa.gov/43yYj0w
It’s giving…life.    #WorldOceansDay

Join us for a Twitter Space! We’re celebrating 50 years of studying gamma-ray bursts, spurts of bright light coming from some of the largest explosions in the universe. Hear from experts about gamma-ray astronomy & the high-energy events that create them.

We're going on a spacewalk!

Join us tomorrow, June 9, as @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody step outside the @Space_Station. Friday's spacewalk is scheduled to start at 9:15am ET (1315 UTC), with live coverage beginning at 7:45am ET (1145 UTC) on Twitter and NASA TV.
Stay tuned: Our UAP study panelists are taking a brief break. Check the agenda for the upcoming topics and timeline: http://go.nasa.gov/3MFpP5T

NOW: We're holding a public meeting of our independent study team for categorizing and evaluating data of unidentified anomalous phenomena, or UAP. More info on today's meeting: https://go.nasa.gov/3nVqp7g

#Ax2 is on its way to space!

The all-private astronaut mission lifted off from 
@NASAKennedy
 at 5:37pm ET (2137 UTC).

We have final engine cutoff of 
@RocketLab
's Curie engine on #RocketLikeAHurricane carrying two TROPICS CubeSats.  

Expected Payload Deployment!   

It will take several orbits to confirm signal. Follow along for more mission updates! http://blogs.nasa.gov/smallsatellites/…

Not too hot, not too cold.

No, not April 25. It's what 
@NASAExoplanets
 scientists call the habitable zone of a star—the range where liquid water could exist on a planet's surface: https://go.nasa.gov/41FqY3w

The first of two TROPICS launches will send cyclone-tracking CubeSats to low Earth orbit from New Zealand. The launch window opens at 9pm ET April 30 (0100 UTC May 1).

A second launch is planned for May 16 to complete the constellation: http://go.nasa.gov/3Ax7aDG

Launched 33 years ago today, the orbiting telescope captured this image of a nebula where stars are born -- 960 light-years away. http://go.nasa.gov/3VizSlr

Six months from today – on October 14 – a “ring of fire” annular eclipse will cross the U.S.!

But what is an annular eclipse?
Why does it happen?
Why does it look like a “ring of fire” in the sky?

This new video will tell you all about it!

This #WorldQuantumDay, discover what the quantum realm is really like and how NASA studies it every day—with Ant-Man actor Paul Rudd!

Find out how our exploration of quantum science could help unlock the universe’s biggest mysteries. https://go.nasa.gov/3U0RjG9

Ingenuity perseveres.

Our #MarsHelicopter just flew its 50th flight on the Red Planet (out of a planned five), nearly two years after it first took to the Martian skies. This demo is giving a glimpse of the future of powered flight on other worlds. https://mars.nasa.gov/ingenuity
